conditions.name: Moderate Transaminase Elevation
conditions.description: Criteria for temporary dose interruption due to liver enzyme elevation.
conditions.text: ALT or AST > 3 to <= 5 x ULN

conditions.name: Severe Transaminase Elevation
conditions.description: Criteria for permanent discontinuation due to severe liver enzyme elevation.

conditions.name: Hy's Law Criteria
conditions.description: Criteria for dose interruption due to potential severe liver injury.
conditions.text: Bilirubin > 2 x ULN accompanied by ALT > 3 x ULN

conditions.name: Hemoglobin Decrease
conditions.description: Criteria for dose reduction due to anemia.
conditions.text: Hemoglobin < 10 g/dL or > 20% decrease from baseline

conditions.name: Platelet Decrease
conditions.description: Criteria for dose reduction due to thrombocytopenia.

conditions.name: Neutrophil Decrease
conditions.description: Criteria for dose reduction due to neutropenia.
conditions.text: Neutrophils > 30% decrease from baseline and below reference range at baseline

conditions.name: Neurologic Worsening
conditions.description: Criteria for potential dose modification due to neurologic symptoms.
conditions.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment

conditions.name: Psychiatric Worsening
conditions.description: Criteria for potential dose modification due to psychiatric symptoms.
conditions.text: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening which may include but not limited to suicidality, acute depression, or psychosis.

conditions.name: Safety Concerns Pre-Titration
conditions.description: General safety criteria that may prevent dose titration.
conditions.text: Safety concerns that, in the opinion of the Investigator(s) and/or Alexion, may place participants at undue risk.

conditions.name: General Discontinuation Criteria
conditions.description: List of events that trigger consideration for study intervention discontinuation.
conditions.text: Serious hypersensitivity reaction; Severe uncontrolled infection; Use of disallowed medication; Pregnancy or planned pregnancy.

transitionRules.name: Dose Titration to 30mg
transitionRules.text: On Day 29, participants will be titrated up to 30 mg/day, unless there are safety concerns.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Moderate LFT Elevation
transitionRules.text: If ALT or AST > 3 to <= 5 x ULN, temporarily interrupt dosing.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Severe LFT Elevation
transitionRules.text: If ALT or AST > 5 x ULN, discontinue study intervention.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Hematologic Toxicity
transitionRules.text: If hemoglobin, platelet, or neutrophil criteria are met, reduce dose to previous dose level or to 15 mg QOD if on 15 mg QD.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Hy's Law
transitionRules.text: If Bilirubin > 2x ULN with ALT > 3x ULN, temporarily interrupt dosing.

transitionRules.name: Dose Modification for Neurologic/Psychiatric Worsening
transitionRules.text: If neurologic or psychiatric worsening occurs, Investigator and Alexion Medical Monitor will evaluate the need for dose modification (interruption, increase or decrease).

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for General Safety Reasons
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for serious hypersensitivity, severe infection, disallowed medication use, or pregnancy.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant is considered to have completed the study if he/she has completed all phases of the study including the last scheduled procedure shown in the Schedule of Activities.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Participant Withdrawal of Consent
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may withdraw from the study at any time at his/her own request.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Investigator Discretionary Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may be withdrawn at any time at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant will be considered lost to follow-up if he or she repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted by the study site.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Sponsor Termination of Study
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Alexion reserves the right to close the study site or terminate the study at any time for any reason.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Site Closure
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Reasons for early closure of a study site include failure to comply with protocol, inadequate recruitment, or discontinuation of study intervention development.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose Titration Safety Review
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Before titration to 30 mg/day on Day 29, the Safety Review Committee (SRC) will review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant.
